newsitem.title: CANADA: TCPL, Gaz Metro plan pipeline.
newsitem.headline: TCPL, Gaz Metro plan pipeline.

text.p: TransCanada PipeLines Ltd and Gaz Metropolitain & Co LP said on Thursday they plan to apply to Canada's National Energy Board to build a C$1-billion pipeline to transport Sable Island natural gas.
The companies said the pipeline would move the gas to Bernieres, Quebec to serve Canadian and U.S. markets from Country Harbour, Nova Scotia.

The proposed pipeline, which would be part of the co-owned Trans Quebec & Maritimes system, will be similar to the original TransQuebec & Maritimes extension project that was approved by the NEB in 1981, the companies said.

The proposed 900 km pipeline would be linked to TransCanada's Canadian mainline system, providing extensive access for Sable Island gas to the Canadian Maritimes, Quebec, Ontario and the U.S. northeast market areas, they said.
Initial capacity would be the same as anticipated production from the Sable Island field, currently seen at 400 million cubic feet per day, they said.

The pipeline would link Country Harbour and Bernieres, passing through New Glasgow and Amherst in Nova Scotia, and Moncton, Fredericton and Edmunston in New Brunswick as well as Riviere-du-Loup in Quebec.
Laterals are planned for Saint John, New Brunswick and Halifax and Dartmouth in Nova Scotia.
The firms said access to U.S. markets would be achieved via existing pipelines and others in development in Canada and the United States.

The proposed development schedule is in line with development of the Sable Island field. Should producers decide to move forward in mid-1997, the pipeline could be placed in service by November 1999, they said. -- Reuters Calgary Bureau 403 531-1624
